Syria's President Bashar al-assad has

its stockpile of chemical weapons but
there's a complication Syria is a war
zone and multiple countries have refused
to have the work done within their
borders so the weapons are going to be
destroyed at sea this map shows the
route the weapons will take Scandinavian
vessels are picking up the munitions at
a port in Syria and carrying them to
Italy that's where the US cargo ship
Cape ray will be waiting the Cape ray
will ferry the chemicals to
international waters where they'll be
destroyed to carry out the task for the
US Department of Defense has developed a
mobile neutralizer for chemical weapons
this field deployable hydrolysis system
destroys sulfur mustard agents sarin and
